column4: hi, I just got my CD for 8.04 LTS desktop in the post today, I opened it, slapped it into my drive, rebooted the computer to go into auto-install, and about 5-10mins into the install, a lot of text comes up, saying "zlib_inflate" or something like that failed. I checked the cd for defects and it said 2 files had errors. Any help so I can install it asap?
use another disc
jrib; impossible.
it's impossible to use this one if it has defects.
jrib; it's also impossible to install Ubuntu from a non-exsistant disc.
_Zeus_; so you're saying that the company Ubuntu has teamed up with, provides bad discs?
From Ubuntu's "Request a free CD" page.
I've gotten a couple of bad discs, yeah.  Why can't you install ubuntu another way?
jrib; my cd drive doesn't like to burn ISO's properly, for some reason.
there are other ways, check ubottu's link.  You can also find a LoCo or LUG in your area that will burn a disc for you
!install > ChrizC
for god sakes, stop the highlights ¬¬
my drive won't burn ISO's properly.
this channel has over 1000 users. You need to highlight people you are having a conversation with
jrib; I can't download it, I can't torrent it, no one in my local area likes Linux, so won't burn it, and the CD's take too long to get here for me to order another one.
you can purchase one from amazon as well
_Zeus_; Southwest.
jrib; I'm not paying for something I can get for free, lols.
what state?
jrib; the good ol' united kingdom.
Obviously not, _Zeus_, seeing as I'm on this IRC channel ¬¬
there's a big ubuntu community in the UK.  Try #ubuntu-uk
